results.title: Peaches are a lustful fruit
results.brief_description: In 1960, when Domenic was 10, his father left Italy for Australia to work in Cobram. A year later Domenic followed with his mother and sisters. ” I never went to school in Australia so my voyage from Italy was the end of my childhood” Domenic’s story represents that of the many migrant workers who have helped build Australian agriculture. Created as part of the Racconti: La Voce del Popolo Digital Storytelling in association with The Italian Federation of Migrant Workers and their Families (FILEF).

results.title: Next generation
results.brief_description: As the daughter of migrant parents Nella often felt “different and isolated from the other children at school”. Her strict father did not allow her to experience some of the advantages life in Australia had to offer so Nella was determined that her own daughter would have what she couldn’t. Created as part of the Racconti: La Voce del Popolo Digital Storytelling in association with The Italian Federation of Migrant Workers and their Families (FILEF).

results.title: Lands apart
results.brief_description: In this story Cathy tells the story of her parents who migrated to Australia and thanks them ” for your strength and the sacrifices you made to give us a better life” Created as part of the Racconti: La Voce del Popolo Digital Storytelling in association with The Italian Federation of Migrant Workers and their Families (FILEF).

results.title: Journey home
results.creator_credit: Maria De Maria and Valarie De Maria
results.brief_description: Maria tells us the story of migration, hard work, loneliness and sacrifice that was her experience of leaving her native land to move to the other side of the world. There were many hard times, and she still misses Italy ‘but now I call Australia home’. Created as part of the Racconti: La Voce del Popolo Digital Storytelling in association with The Italian Federation of Migrant Workers and their Families (FILEF).

results.title: It's never too late
results.brief_description: Maria claims that her first day in this country in 1959 was ‘magic’ but that in her new life everyone had to work hard and there was no time for lighthearted things. However in 1995 she experienced a change in life that taught her “It’s never too late”. Created as part of the Racconti: La Voce del Popolo Digital Storytelling in association with The Italian Federation of Migrant Workers and their Families (FILEF).
